title: 加州橡树岭高中社会学实验课堂

action: Sit quietly at desk, observe classroom setup and teacher
thoughts: First day of this sociology experiment. I should follow all the rules carefully and make a good impression. The classroom looks very organized with the flags and uniform requirements. I wonder what the armbands mean.
memory: Noticed classroom has American and California flags
Preparing to follow uniform and conduct rules

action: Raise hand to ask teacher about the armband system
speech: Excuse me, could you explain how the armband selection works?
thoughts: I want to understand the rules properly so I can follow them correctly and maybe earn an armband position
memory: Asking teacher about armband system to better understand rules
Trying to demonstrate engagement with authority figures

action: Nod in understanding and make a note in notebook
thoughts: I understand now - the teacher has complete discretion over armband selection. I should accept this authority decision without question and focus on following the rules properly to maintain good standing.
memory: Teacher clarified armband selection is solely at teacher's discretion
Need to accept authority decisions without questioning
Making notes helps demonstrate engagement with classroom rules

action: Continue reviewing notebook notes about armband selection criteria while maintaining proper posture
thoughts: The teacher made it clear that armband selection is based on academic performance and classroom behavior. I need to understand these criteria thoroughly to improve my chances. Following rules and showing respect for authority is the key to being selected.
memory: Teacher emphasized armband selection based on academic performance and behavior
Need to demonstrate rule-following behavior to improve selection chances
Continuing to study selection criteria shows engagement with authority expectations
